intro: Aglaonema brevispathum, commonly known as the short-path aglaonema, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage with dark green veins contrasting against light green or white leaf blades. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring lance-shaped leaves that are short and broad at the base. It thrives in low-light conditions and requires moderate humidity and well-draining soil. Aglaonema brevispathum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and air-purifying properties.
